newsitem.title: USA: Hearing begins on Mo. school desegregation case.
newsitem.headline: Hearing begins on Mo. school desegregation case.

text.p: - A federal court hearing began Monday on Missouri's bid to end its financial support for desegregating the Kansas City School District, The Star reported Tuesday.
The newspaper reported that U.S. District Judge Russell G. Clark will spend this month in a hearing on the state's request.

Lawyers for the state contend that Missouri has completed its job -- spending more than $1 billion over 10 years on the district. As a good faith gesture, the state has offered the district an additional $314 million through 1999, the newspaper said.
However, the plaintiffs in the desegregation case oppose both the settlement and the state's release from the case, the newspaper reported.
